intro: Psychotria distichodoma, commonly known as the two-ranked psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically eaten by birds. Psychotria distichodoma is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
